message: Oh hello. What are you doing here? You got lost?
Just walk around the fence and head to the north. Soon you'll be in Fallhaven.
Oh yes, I am Gison. I live in this wood with my wife Nimael. She's over there.
How can I help you?

replies.text: Alaun sent me to bring him some of your delicious soup.
I'm looking for my brother, Andor. He looks a bit like me. Have you seen him?
Nevermind. I guess I need to be going.

message: We live here from what the forest gives us. Surely we have to buy some things in Fallhaven, but I prefer the silence of these woods rather than the hectic life in a city.

Herbs, animals and above all: Mushrooms. 
 If you would like to know more about mushrooms, I suggest you go to Bogsten, east of here. He grows the best mushrooms you ever ate! But well, I don't want to give away any more secrets of my soup.
Next to my passion for mushrooms, we build here and there on our house and try to keep the wild animals out.

replies.text: I see. Let's talk about something else.

message: Well, all right. As you wish.
Hahaha. Alaun the old swashbuckler. Could not get enough. I will fix something up for him. Wait here.
Gison goes to a big bowl, fills up some of the soup and returns to you.

Here you go.
[He gives you a container with the soup.]
Give him my regards and hurry up. He likes his soup hot.

replies.text: Alaun will get his soup soon enough.

message: Hello you. Did you take the soup to Alaun?

replies.text: Yes, he was not able to bear it any longer.
No, I still have it with me.
No ... ehm ... Maybe you could give me some more?
Could you make it hot again?

message: Then hurry up. A hungry Alaun is an angry Alaun.

replies.text: Yes, yes. He'll get it soon.

message:
Good. Alaun will be very satisfied.
You didn't perchance bring the empty bottle back, did you?

replies.text:
Yes I have. Here is it.
[You give Gison the empty bottle.]
No. I forgot it. I'm sorry.

message: Oh no, too bad. Please bring me an empty bottle once you've found one.
Oh good. Thanks.

replies.text: I won't do this whole stupid running around again just for an empty bottle. Bye.
Alaun said that your wife also makes very good soup.

message: Ate it yourself, did you? Haha, I hope it tasted good.

No problem, I'll give you more.
However, this time you'll have to pay 5 gold for it.

replies.text: Let's adjourn it to another day, old man.
Yes, ok. Here are 5 gold pieces.

message:
[Gison gives you a new bottle with hot soup.]
Here you go.

No problem, I'll give you more.
However, this time you'll have to pay 50 gold for it.

replies.text: Let's adjourn it to another day, old man.
Yes, ok. Here are 50 gold pieces.

message:
[Gison gives you a new bottle with hot soup.]
Here you go.

No problem, I'll give you more.
However, this time you'll have to pay 500 gold for it.

replies.text: Let's adjourn it to another day, old man.
Yes, ok. Here are 500 gold pieces.

message:
[Gison gives you a new bottle with hot soup.]
Here you go.

No problem, I'll give you more.
However, this time you'll have to pay 5000 gold for it.

replies.text: Let's adjourn it to another day, old man.
Yes, ok. Here are 5000 gold pieces.

message:
[Gison gives you a new bottle with hot soup.]
Here you go.
I can't give you more. Take this one to Alaun now, greedy lad!
I'm sorry for Alaun. I guess he has to get some himself.

I told you to not linger. But I can make it hot. Give me a moment.
[Gison pours the soup back in the bowl and fills the bottle up again with hot soup.]
Here you go.
Oh, you are back!

replies.text: I want to return your bottle.
I just want to say hello.
I just want to say hello.
Alaun told me that your wife also makes very good soup.
I wanted to ask you about something.

message: Thank you.

replies.text: I have to go again. Bye.
Alaun said your wife also makes very good soup.

message: You have to help me.
Bandits raided my house. They even knocked me and Nimael unconscious.

Strangely they only took my old cookbook with them.
Please help me get back my book, otherwise I cannot make my delicious mushroom soup.

replies.text: A raid for an old cookbook?
Search on your own, old man.

message: The thieves took away my cookbook with the precious recipe for mushroom soup.
I don't know why they only took the book. Maybe it's because of the one chapter... *brooding*
What? Yes, yes, the chapter... It contained several pages with strange letters written between the recipes.

I obtained the book some years ago. It was a present from Bogsten - you know him? - and instantly I took a fancy for these fabulous recipes.
Please find it and return it to me.
That's a good question. I don't know that language, therefore I ignored the pages for ages. Maybe the robbers know what that chapter is about.
You want a reward?
I don't have that much money. As a simple token of gratitude I can offer to make some soup for you. I don't own very much more.

replies.text: I guess it's not worth the trouble. Time to go.

message: Well, will you help me?

replies.text: Sure thing. I'll search for your book.

message: Oh, well. I started to believe that I could not trust my knowledge of human nature anymore.
I really thank you.
The robbers came from the south. Maybe you should start your search in that direction. Take care!
Did you find my precious cook book?

replies.text: [Lie] I found the robbers, but they had destroyed the book.

message: Is it really true? I can't believe it!

replies.text: A sorcerer named Zuul'khan was reciting dark words from it. You were right, the robbers wanted these strange written lines.

message: But you have two similar looking books?

replies.text: Yes, the robbers have made a complete copy of the book, just without the spell.

message: Then give me the copy. I don't want to be raided again.

replies.text: OK. Then I'll take the version with the spell. I can't read the dark words, but that doesn't bother me.

message: Noo!
Well, you tried to help. Thank you.
It's a pity that I can't cook my delicious soup any more.
Thank you for your help retrieving my precious cookbook. Would you like some soup as a small reward?
Give me 2 of Bogsten's mushrooms and an empty bottle, then I could sell you a portion for only 50 gold.
Hello kid.
Please help us. We got raided.
I don't know exactly. Everything went so fast ... I'm too upset and my head hurts too much.
If you want to help us, please talk to Gison.
I'm busy at the moment. Please talk to Gison. He's over there.

replies.text: Alaun told me that you also make very good soup.
While exploring the Sullengard forest, I stumbled across this giant mushroom and was wondering if you knew what it was.

message: Thanks for helping us!

replies.text: I only hope it'll be worth the trouble.

message: Shut the door, please!
From the outside.
No, I am not Gison!
And no, I have no soup for anyone!
I hate this smell!
You have some of that disgusting soup in your bag! I can smell it.
Out with you!
I hear those soup bottles clinking in your bag.
Even though they are empty, I hate that sound!
Hi kid. I am Gael, son of those people in the house over there.
I moved out here because I couldn't stand the suffocating smell of mushroom soup anymore. Or vegetable soup, for that matter.
I like meat. Wolves, boars, dogs, puppies. Any kind, really.
And snakes, of course. They give the finest meat of all.
Cooked, grilled, baked, fried, stewed...ahh, snake meat - nothing compares to it!

replies.text: To each his own, I guess.
Cooked meat? Who cooks your meat?

message: Now that I mention it: I am running out of meat. I'll have to go out hunting again.

replies.text: Would you like me to give you some meat?
Good luck! I am leaving then.

message: Really?

replies.text: Oh, I just noticed that I don't have enough meat with me. I will be back soon with 10 pieces of meat, just you wait.
Here, I have 10 nice pieces of meat for you. I cannot promise that it is all from snakes, though.
Here, I have 10 nice pieces of lamb meat for you. Maybe not as good as snake though.
Here, I have 8 nice pieces of snake meat for you.

message: Excellent! In return, I can give you this nice little purse, made of the finest snake leather. Look here, isn't it beautiful?

replies.text: Wow, it is magnificent! Thank you!

message: May it serve you well.
You look at a wall of stones. There's no way through.
You examine the wall more closely and discover an entrance hidden beneath moss and leaves.

replies.text: The gap is big enough that you could squeeze through it.

message: Aaah. Welcome back my friend.
Is there anything I can help you with?

replies.text: Please give me some more soup.

message: I still have some of my delicious soup. How many bottles of soup do you want?

replies.text: I need soup! At least ten bottles! Quick!!
I don't have an empty bottle.
I have to get more of Bogsten's mushrooms.
I just noticed that my gold fund is low.

message: You brought an empty bottle, Bogsten's mushrooms and the 50 gold. Here it is.
You don't have the items I need for that exchange. Bring me an empty bottle, two of Bogsten's mushrooms and 50 gold for each portion.

replies.text: I will be back with those.

message: You brought all ingredients needed for 5 portions. Here you go.

Whoah. You are hungry, aren't you?
Here you go.
Let's pretend that you have not seen my master over there, practicing dark magic with the old spell in this book we have stolen. Go away!

replies.text: Hmm, maybe that is a good idea. I'll tell Gison that you have destroyed the book.

message: We agreed that there was nothing to see here. So get out of here.

replies.text: So what? I have changed my mind. Move aside if you love your life!

message: Hahaha! You are funny. Hahahaha!
Do that. And now be gone!
[muttering ominous words]
What ...? You again? How did you get in here?

replies.text: I have come to retrieve a book that does not belong to you.

message: Ha! You made a serious error coming here. I have a use for you though.

replies.text: You want me to help you?

message: Not exactly. My fungi leader is almost ready. It just needs to be fed some more to grow in strength.
Unfortunately the case is locked.
A stone beneath your feet moves a bit. Shortly after spearheads spring off the ground.
Suddenly the earth shakes, and a part of the wall falls in the corridor directly in front of you.
You find an empty bottle.
You find a bottle.
You find an empty bottle.
You find an empty bottle.
You find an empty bottle.
You find an empty bottle.
You find three empty bottles.
You feel a sudden sharp pain. What might be inside here?
Oh, what's this? Ouch!
There is a small hole in the cave wall here.
